channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tony Award Winners 2024: Updating List
item.description: The Tony Awards were held on Sunday at Lincoln Center’s David H. Koch Theater in New York City.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israel Says It Will Reduce Fighting in Part of Southern Gaza
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu signaled he was surprised by the military saying it would pause daytime operations in an important aid corridor. Military officials emphasized that the Rafah offensive would continue.

item.title: Bill Gates says he's ready to plow billions into a next-gen nuclear plant being built by his startup
item.description: “I put in over a billion, and I’ll put in billions more,” said Gates.

item.title: Post Fire in Southern California May Foreshadow a Hazardous Summer
item.description: The Post fire northwest of Los Angeles has burned over 14,000 acres and illustrates the danger of built-up vegetation after rainy winters.

item.title: Belgian Campus Protests Over War in Gaza Take Different Tone
item.description: Pro-Palestinian student activists at one Belgian university have borrowed from the U.S. playbook of encampments and slogans. The results, however, have been starkly different.

item.title: Top Wall Street bear surrenders to bull market and flips forecast, now seeing the S&P 500 soaring to 6,000 by year-end
item.description: "Today, GenAI’s potential in every job and sector is inflecting. The backdrop of slowing inflation, a Fed intent on cutting rates and growth support Goldilocks.”

item.title: Fact Check: Trump’s and Biden’s Claims on Immigration and Border Security
item.description: We fact-checked claims about migrants and border security from both presidential candidates.

item.title: Monday Briefing: Israel Plans for a Daily Pause in Some Fighting
item.description: Also, an emerging plan to resist Donald Trump and an Iran-Sweden prisoner swap.

item.title: Electricity prices in France turn negative as renewable energy floods the grid
item.description: French day-ahead power fell to -€5.76 a megawatt-hour, the lowest in four years, in an auction on Epex Spot.

item.title: After Splash Park Shooting, Michigan Community Feels a Familiar Pain
item.description: The violence in the city of Rochester Hills, which injured nine people including children, comes three years after the shooting at Oxford High School in the same county.

item.title: Deadly Toll in Greece as Heat Waves Sweep the Country
item.description: A New York man was among several foreigners to have gone missing or been found dead in recent days as temperatures in Greece have soared.

item.title: $155 million debut for 'Inside Out 2' is biggest since 'Barbie' and second best ever for Disney's Pixar
item.description: The success is significant for Pixar, marking a much-needed return to form for a studio that has had a string of underwhelming launches.

item.title: Red Carpet Looks From the 77th Annual Tony Awards
item.description: Broadway’s biggest stars made their grand entrance.

item.title: More Than 80 Nations Back Talks to Ease Path to Peace in Ukraine
item.description: Meeting in Switzerland, world leaders backed a joint statement urging more diplomacy, but were divided on how to engage Russia.

item.title: Gen X is the least confident about retirement as 'crunch time' nears—and has done less to prepare than boomers or millennials
item.description: "Gen Xers are reaching crunch time for retirement planning. For Gen Xers, retirement is no longer this far off idea."
